text:
44 yo F with PMH of HTN, asthma and GI stromal tumor s/p multiple
   surgeries and prolonged hospitalizations here with lactic acidosis with
   encephalopathy and liver failure.
   Hepatic encephalopathy
   Assessment:
   Patient sedated on fentanyl/versed boluses. Moves head and extr to pain
   stimuli. Pupils at 2-3mm equal but sluggish to react. Does not follow
   command.  LFT
s still elevated, labile blood sugars
   Action:
   Neuro checks, labs, hepatology consulting, lactulose was d/c, meds at
   hepatic dosage. FS q2hr
   Response:
   Awaiting, brittle FS. D50/50given for FS of 50-60, bicarb drip changed
   from d5 to d10
   Plan:
   Monitor  patients status, labs to eval, f/u hep recs
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name **])
   Assessment:
   Remains intubated and vented on AC 30% 500x24/5 abg: 7.43/19/168.
   Scant amnt of clear secretion w/suctioning.
   Action:
   Vent settings changed to AC 30%500x20/5, mouth care q4hr, bicarb drip
   Response:
   Abg:7.39/25/146 lactate -14.1
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor resp status, abg
s to eval. Wean off when possible
   and acidosis resolves.
   .H/O abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Abd seems to be firmer and more distended than previously. BS present
   but hypoactive, loose stool in ostomy pouch. OGT clamped, residuals up
   to 120cc. Mid abd incision w/vac dressing at 125 mmHg intact.
   Action:
   Continue w/NPO. OGT to low continues suction to decompress. Bladder
   pressures at 20-24, surgery following/managing
   Response:
   awaiting
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor patient status, bladder pressures to eval for
   ACS/IAH
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Oliguric u/o 10-20 cc/hr. BUN/Creat-  20/2.5, electrolyte disturbances,
   CVP at 6, lactate elevated up to 14+
   Action:
   f/u U/O , LR 2000cc bolus given, repleated w/K, Ca, Mg, renal follows,
   labs to eval
   Response:
   awaiting
   Plan:
   Monitor U/O and renal functions, bladder pressures, f/u renal recs. HD
   vs CVVH???
   Neuro: sedated on fent/versed boluses. Pupils @2-3 mm sluggish. Moves
   extr as a response to pain stimuli, otherwise unable to assess patient
   mental status
   Resp: intubated and vented until acidosis resolves. (See note above)
   Cardio: remains tachycardic at 110
s-140
s. after IVF slowed to
   110
s-120
s. ST no ectopy noted.  NBP at 100
s /50
s. Peripheral pulses
   present. Peripheral edema noted. In am NBP at low 90
s U/O <10cc/hr.
   another bolus of NS 500cc given
   GI: NPO, OGT to low continues suction to decompress abd. Gas and stool
   in ostomy. BS present but hypoactive.
   GU: yellow urine via foley, oliguric. Cont w/IVF.
   Skin: mid abd incision w/vac dressing. Intact. Vac@125mmHG.
   IV access: LT IJ 3 lumen. Lt PIV 18G. LT A-line.
   Social: family in to visit updated by RN.
